solution_line_template: He bought {num_perfume_bottles} bottles of perfume that weighed {perfume_weight_per_bottle} oz each so they weighed {num_perfume_bottles}*{perfume_weight_per_bottle} = <<{num_perfume_bottles}*{perfume_weight_per_bottle}={total_perfume_weight_oz}>>{total_perfume_weight_oz} oz

{num_soap_bars} bars of soap weighed {soap_weight_per_bar} oz each so they weighed {num_soap_bars}*{soap_weight_per_bar} = <<{num_soap_bars}*{soap_weight_per_bar}={total_soap_weight_oz}>>{total_soap_weight_oz} oz

{num_jam_jars} jars of jam weighed {jam_weight_per_jar} oz each so they weighed {num_jam_jars}*{jam_weight_per_jar} = <<{jam_weight_per_jar}*{num_jam_jars}={total_jam_weight_oz}>>{total_jam_weight_oz} oz

The perfume is {total_perfume_weight_oz} oz, the soap is {total_soap_weight_oz} oz and the jam is {total_jam_weight_oz} oz for a total of {total_perfume_weight_oz}+{total_soap_weight_oz}+{total_jam_weight_oz} = <<{total_perfume_weight_oz}+{total_soap_weight_oz}+{total_jam_weight_oz}={total_products_weight_oz}>>{total_products_weight_oz} oz

{ounces_per_pound} oz is 1 pound, and he had {total_products_weight_oz} oz in products so he had {total_products_weight_oz}/{ounces_per_pound} = <<{total_products_weight_oz}/{ounces_per_pound}={total_products_weight_lbs}>>{total_products_weight_lbs} pounds of products

His suitcase weighed {initial_suitcase_weight_lbs} pounds, and the chocolate weighed {chocolate_weight_lbs} pounds and the remaining products weighed {total_products_weight_lbs} pounds so his suitcase weighed {initial_suitcase_weight_lbs}+{chocolate_weight_lbs}+{total_products_weight_lbs} = <<{initial_suitcase_weight_lbs}+{chocolate_weight_lbs}+{total_products_weight_lbs}={final_suitcase_weight_lbs}>>{final_suitcase_weight_lbs} pounds
